intro: Tithymalus hieronymi, commonly known as the Hieronymus tithymale, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tithymalus hieronymi is considered a species of conservation concern.
